title: Why not give some Championship Points for regular season standings too?
body:
i think its kind of lame that they only give points in the playoffs. what if the 6th seed ends up winning the whole split? a team that has their shit together right from the beginning and maintains good play through all the patches and meta changes of the regular season doesn't get rewarded at all if they get beat by a team that just comes on late in the season or only plays well against a select few teams or only in the current meta. 

the playoffs should be worth more overall but they could at least give some points for the regular season standings. it would also help make the regular season games more meaningful instead of just "make sure we are at least in the top 6 to make playoffs"

replies.body:
the seedings are very minor rewards. do you really think it matters if a team is 3rd seed or 6th? the bye from the top 2 seeds is a little more valuable but I don't think the first and second seeds would have any trouble beating the 5th and 6th if they got rid of the bye. 

just because no other region does it doesn't mean it isn't a good idea. how bout you come up with an actual reason why it wouldn't be better for the league? like I said, with the current system a low seeded team could take all the marbles if they get hot for a few weeks, have a good matchup in the playoffs, or just happen to play well on the current meta.

Honestly the entire season is used as a platform for the playoffs. It is to see which teams should be in the LCS (promo/relegations) and which team should have the opportunity to play in the international play.

Giving the points at that particular time would not make any sense. This would be like giving Coast/Giants (auto-relegated teams) points when they would literally mean nothing. As the focus of region specific regular season play is to identify those teams that may be a good contention for international play and place them in the Playoffs.

You see the correlation? Identify which teams have Potential for competitive international experience and then flush out that potential with a playoff.

I'm going to make an assumption and point out from what you have stated, you are a CLG fan. There is nothing wrong with that, but honestly, I don't want a team that can't perform in region specific playoffs (no matter how well they appear throughout a regular season) to represent NA internationally in any capacity. Correct me if I'm wrong but, that can be the only reason I can see why you would want a team to be rewarded for regular season play (especially with the crap format of Best of One).
That isn't true.
Please elaborate, as your statement leaves much detail to be desired. Stating something isn't true and not providing what isn't accurate or where the mis-interpretation, is rather annoying.

Isn't group stage in Worlds also best of one? 

Teams such as CLG that plays with effort during regular season should be rewarded for their effort. 

Their effort made NA LCS more interesting.

You want to let a team that only seems to be good at playing best of ones play in the Group Stage of Worlds? Against teams that have proven themselves as the best in their regions (Both Regular season and playoffs)? 

I don't understand the thought process behind that. We want the very best in each region to battle each other in all areas of competition (Best of 1, Playoffs combined!!!!).

What we really want is entertainment. 

If rewarding teams in regular season means more competitive games/ more entertainment, then why not? 

I pay for entertainment.

And team managers/owners pay their team to win (as shown by teams making roster changes based on performance: Goodbye Link :( ). Organizations sponsor teams for publicity which is greater the farther teams go. Teams increase the longevity of their rosters by winning as well as tournament winnings ($$$$$$) and other bonuses. 

Entertainment is our, the fans, goal. 
Every fan has a different idea of entertainment. Some people can watch random no-name people play ARAM and be entertained. Some people are team-centric in focus (Curse or Die!). And some people just want to watch the very best play. And so many other forms of entertainment that can be found with League of Legends.

In a competitive scene for any sport, no one wins worlds by only doing well in their specific region. And while matches can be entertaining, there is no competitive basis in entertaining fans. The only competitive focus is _Who Is The Best_.

I speak from the POV that teams that try the hardest during regular seasons should be rewarded. 

By rewarded, I mean so marginally. Playoff would be rewarded much more.

Them having a career(getting a salery) as an esports team and living in a gaming house isn't reward enough. What about the enjoyment of being cheered on in a studio twice a week? 

I mean, playing games and getting paid to do so, sounds rewarding to me.

yes I know that the entire regular season is just for playoff seeding and that's what im trying to fix. all im saying is that they should split up the rewards between regular season performance and playoff performance. 

playoff performance is just a snapshot of skill at that time. the regular season rankings reflect a teams ability to be consistent and to adapt to meta changes at the beginning and throughout the season - 2 things that I feel should be rewarded more.

I still think they should do it like I mentioned below (in my additional note) about the LCK Regular season ranks affecting tournament standings to such a degree if a true underdog is on the rise, then they have to go through everyone to prove it.

That would be more rewarding without directly interfering with Championship Points (well at least fully since some teams would be guaranteed points based off their performance).

On an additional note: In regards to your "No other regions do this" statement from whoever commented about it. There is a region that rewards Seasonal Play for Playoffs. LCK (Korea) runs a gauntlet system.

If you don't know what this is I will explain.

Standings throughout the season predict your placement in the playoffs. The most impressive or detrimental (whether you are a fan of giving incentives in the playoff for seasonal play) feature of this is that First place throughout the season is automatically in the Playoff Finals. 2nd place is automatically in the Semi finals. 3/4 are the first quarter-final. So the winner of the Quarter Faces 2nd place. And the Winner of Semi takes on 1st place team.

In addition to this, Even though in LCK only 4 teams are in the playoffs they still use the Point System for worlds that Riot promotes,

So 5th and 6th place teams get 10 points, but other places points are once again determined by playoff standings. (Loser of the Quarter is 4/ Loser of the Semi is 3rd/ Etc.)

This would look something like this if applied to the LCS:

5/6 first match > Winner takes on 4th > Winner takes on 3rd > Winner Takes on 2nd > Winner takes on 1st

NA: (TL vs GV > vs TiP > vs CLG > vs C9 > vs TSM)
EU: (CW vs UoL > vs GMB > vs h2K > vs Fnatic > vs SK)

Back to the point of CLG they would have only been guaranteed 20 more Championship points, because they would have been guaranteed at least a 4th place finish if this gauntlet format was run.

you could give 10 points for first place in regular season, 9 for second, 8 for third and so on. then give 14 for whoever wins the playoffs, 12 for the runner up, 10 for the other 2 semifinalists, and 8 for the two teams that lost in the first round. this puts more value on the playoffs so that a first place regular season team that gets runner up in the playoffs will still be below a second place regular season team that wins the playoffs. then you could double the points for the results of the summer split so that teams can make up a lot of ground during the summer. its a good blend of the different skills needed to win in the regular season and the playoffs.

That would completely break the entire value of the purposed point system. You'll notice the point system is values of 10 for a reason (no fracken 99 to 99 ties).

Keep in mind that the Championship Points are Riots idea to keep some semblance of consistency between regions that have varying formats.

LCK with their Best of 3 (Each team playing each other twice over the course of two 6 week half-splits both equaling a full split)
LPL with their Series of 2 (Each team playing each other twice)
NA/EU LCS with their Best of 1 (Each team playing each other twice)
LMS with their Best of 1 (Each team playing each other three times)

The points that Riot proposed are to keep things consistent. Each region also has a different number of teams.

NA/EU have 10 each.
LCK have 8.
LMS have 8.
LPL have 12.

Your method of rewarding regular season play with Championship points only that are only used for worlds would in all honesty be completely and un-necessarily messy. 

How fair is it to reward points to teams in LPL that purposely troll the last two weeks to get the seating they want to so they have the best chance in the playoffs? How about LCK when Standings are finalized, but you have KT kicking ass and looking badass, and still not getting any points?

The way it is now gives incentive to teams to make it to the playoffs. You don't make it, you have no real reason to get points. You make it, you fight for more.
